org.apache.ambari.server.orm.entities

Class AlertDefinitionEntity

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.ambari.server.orm.entities.AlertDefinitionEntity

  • @Entity
public class AlertDefinitionEntity
extends Object
    The AlertDefinitionEntity class is used to model an alert that needs to run in the system. Each received alert from an agent will essentially be an instance of this template.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AlertDefinitionEntity()
      Constructor.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void addAlertGroup(AlertGroupEntity alertGroup)
      Adds the specified alert group to the groups that this definition is associated with.
      boolean equals(Object object)
      Gets the equality to another historical alert entry based on the following criteria: definitionId clusterId definitionName

      However, since we're guaranteed that definitionId is unique among persisted entities, we can return the hashCode based on this value if it is set.

        Sets the unique identifier for this alert definition.
        Parameters:
        definitionId - the ID (not null).

      • getSource

        public String getSource()
        Gets the source that defines the type of alert and the alert properties. This is typically a JSON structure that can be mapped to a first-class object.
        Returns:
        the alert source (never null).

      • setSource

        public void setSource(String alertSource)
        Sets the source of the alert, typically in JSON, that defines the type of the alert and its properties.
        Parameters:
        alertSource - the alert source (not null).

      • getClusterId

        public Long getClusterId()
        Gets the ID of the cluster that this alert definition is created for. Each cluster has their own set of alert definitions that are not shared with any other cluster.
        Returns:
        the ID of the cluster (never null).

      • setClusterId

        public void setClusterId(Long clusterId)
        Sets the ID of the cluster that this alert definition is created for. Each cluster has their own set of alert definitions that are not shared with any other cluster.
        Parameters:
        clusterId - the ID of the cluster (not null).

        public ClusterEntity getCluster()
        Gets the cluster that this alert definition is a member of.
        Returns:

      • setCluster

        public void setCluster(ClusterEntity clusterEntity)
        Sets the cluster that the alert definition is a member of.
        Parameters:
        clusterEntity -

      • getComponentName

        public String getComponentName()
        Gets the component name that this alert is associated with, if any. Some alerts are scoped at the service level and will not have a component name.
        Returns:
        the component name or null if none.

      • setComponentName

        public void setComponentName(String componentName)
        Sets the component name that this alert is associated with, if any. Some alerts are scoped at the service level and will not have a component name.
        Parameters:
        componentName - the component name or null if none.

      • getScope

        public Scope getScope()
        Gets the scope of the alert definition. The scope is defined as either being for a Scope.SERVICE or Scope.HOST.
        Returns:
        the scope, or null if not defined.

      • setScope

        public void setScope(Scope scope)
        Sets the scope of the alert definition. The scope is defined as either being for a Scope.SERVICE or Scope.HOST.
        Parameters:
        scope - the scope to set, or null for none.

      • getDefinitionName

        public String getDefinitionName()
        Gets the name of this alert definition. Alert definition names are unique within a cluster.
        Returns:
        the name of the alert definition (never null).

      • setDefinitionName

        public void setDefinitionName(String definitionName)
        Sets the name of this alert definition. Alert definition names are unique within a cluster.
        Parameters:
        definitionName - the name of the alert definition (not null).

      • getEnabled

        public boolean getEnabled()
        Gets whether this alert definition is enabled. Disabling an alert definition will prevent agents from scheduling the alerts. No alerts will be triggered and no alert data will be collected.
        Returns:
        true if this alert definition is enabled, false otherwise.

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets whether this alert definition is enabled.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true if this alert definition is enabled, false otherwise.

      • isHostIgnored

        public boolean isHostIgnored()
        Gets whether this alert definition will ignore the hosts reporting the alert and combine them all into a single alert entry.
        Returns:
        true if this alert definition is to ignore hosts and combine all alert instances into a single entry, false otherwise.

      • setHostIgnored

        public void setHostIgnored(boolean ignoreHost)
        Sets whether this alert definition will ignore the hosts reporting the alert and combine them all into a single alert entry.
        Parameters:
        ignoreHost - true if this alert definition is to ignore hosts and combine all alert instances into a single entry, false otherwise.

      • getHash

        public String getHash()
        Gets the unique hash for the current state of this definition. If a property of this definition changes, a new hash is calculated.
        Returns:
        the unique hash or null if there is none.

      • setHash

        public void setHash(String hash)
        Gets the unique hash for the current state of this definition. If a property of this definition changes, a new hash is calculated.
        Parameters:
        hash - the unique hash to set or null for none.

        Gets the name of the service that this alert definition is associated with. Every alert definition is associated with exactly one service.

        the name of the service (never null).

        Gets the name of the service that this alert definition is associated with. Every alert definition is associated with exactly one service.
        Parameters:

      • getRepeatTolerance

        public int getRepeatTolerance()
        Gets the number of sequential instances of an non-OK AlertState must be received in order to consider the alert instance as truly being in that AlertState.

        A value of 1 or less indicates that there is no tolerance and a single alert will cause dispatching of alert notifications.

        Returns:
        the repeatTolerance

      • setRepeatTolerance

        public void setRepeatTolerance(int repeatTolerance)
        Sets the number of sequential instances of an non-OK AlertState must be received in order to consider the alert instance as truly being in that AlertState.

        A value of 1 or less indicates that there is no tolerance and a single alert will cause dispatching of alert notifications.

        Parameters:
        repeatTolerance - the tolerance to set

      • isRepeatToleranceEnabled

        public boolean isRepeatToleranceEnabled()
        Gets whether this definition overrides the default global tolerance value specified in cluster-env/alerts.repeat.tolerance. If enabled, the value from getRepeatTolerance() should be used to calculate retry tolerance.
        Returns:
        the repeatToleranceEnabled true to override the global value.

      • setRepeatToleranceEnabled

        public void setRepeatToleranceEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets whether this definition overrides the default global tolerance value specified in cluster-env/alerts.repeat.tolerance. If enabled, the value from getRepeatTolerance() should be used to calculate retry tolerance.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true to override the defautlt value and use the value returned from getRepeatTolerance().

      • addAlertGroup

        protected void addAlertGroup(AlertGroupEntity alertGroup)
        Adds the specified alert group to the groups that this definition is associated with. This is used to complement the JPA bidirectional association.
        Parameters:
        alertGroup -

      • removeAlertGroup

        protected void removeAlertGroup(AlertGroupEntity alertGroup)
        Removes the specified alert group to the groups that this definition is associated with. This is used to complement the JPA bidirectional association.
        Parameters:
        alertGroup -

      • preRemove

        public void preRemove()
        Called before EntityManager.remove(Object) for this entity, removes the non-owning relationship between definitions and groups.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object object)
        Gets the equality to another historical alert entry based on the following criteria:
        • definitionId
        • clusterId
        • definitionName

        However, since we're guaranteed that definitionId is unique among persisted entities, we can return the hashCode based on this value if it is set.

        Overrides:
        equals in class Object

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Gets a hash to uniquely identify this alert definition. Since we're guaranteed that definitionId is unique among persisted entities, we can return the hashCode based on this value if it is set.

        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
